data.title: Strategy Project Manager, Content Security at DISNEY
data.meta_description: Learn more about applying for Strategy Project Manager, Content Security at DISNEY
data.text:
For over 90 years, The Walt Disney Studios has been the foundation on which The Walt Disney Company was built. Today the Studio brings quality movies, music and stage plays to consumers throughout the world. Feature films are released under the following banners: Disney, including Walt Disney Animation Studios and Pixar Animation Studios, Disneynature, Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm. The Disney Music Group encompasses the Walt Disney Records and Hollywood Records labels, as well as Disney Music Publishing. The Disney Theatrical Group produces and licenses live events, including Disney on Broadway, Disney on Ice and Disney Live! Ours is a culture of innovation, inspiration and collaboration that brings together visionary artists, gifted technologists and savvy business minds to conjure up magical entertainment experiences for a global audience

At The Walt Disney Studios (TWDS), you will be part of a team that helps propel our legacy into the future with a vision as far-reaching as our characters, worlds, and stories. The Content Security (CS) team Is a part of the Studio Technology organization Inside The Walt Disney Studios supporting studio banners in protecting content creation through effective problem-solving, authentic partnerships, and technical expertise. Our team drives towards goals that include :

a. Fostering a culture of content security

b. Eliminating the risk of content leaks

c. Tailoring security solutions to meet our partners’ needs.

We are looking for a Project Manager to help align the strategy and vision for the Content Security team. A successful candidate is someone who can step into and navigate a complex and high-paced environment of hardworking, friendly, and passionate people. You are someone who is bright, detail-oriented, a problem solver, and confident; someone who will continue to drive the organization and initiatives critical to the success of Content Security.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Partner with various functions in the organization including Business Advisory, Site Security, and Application & Cloud teams to help deliver Content Security services

Drive cross-functional platform assessments, and ensure work is delivered in an organized and timely fashion with quality results and reporting to leadership and external stakeholders

Assist with assessment programs, directing activities including but not limited to penetration testing, vendor security testing, SaaS security testing, cloud infrastructure (AWS), etc.

Work with the Sr Manager of Strategy to build a program including consistency of deliverables, anticipated project work, communications, and process for executing security assessments

Drive consensus around proposed approach to solutions designed to eliminate project roadblocks

Understand needs of the full department and perform research on tools that can enhance the Content Security experience including GenAI and machine learning

Manage dashboarding for monitoring and holding functions accountable to OKRs

Coordinate an annual Content Security Summit including logistics and responsible for ensuring a positive and impactful experience for attendees

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintain end to end budget tracking, forecasting yearly budget and reporting spend to leadership, coordinate with Finance on budget and actuals

Assist in scheduling and managing logistics for team events and activities

Understand the needs of the organization for contractors and manage POs and Invoices across functions

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

3+ years of experience in Program Management within the technology and media sector

Excellent communication and time management skills with the ability to shift from project to project without missing a step

Project management of complex initiatives, specifically application and site assessments

Tech-savvy and well-versed in Smartsheet, Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Keynote

Excellent verbal and written skills

Ability to work and build relationships with Disney employees at all levels

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:

BA/BS or equivalent experience preferred

The hiring range for this position in California is $102,500.00-$137,500.00 per year based on a 40 hour work week. The amount of hours scheduled per week may vary based on business needs. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.
